Building the Library for Your System

The Reflexxes Motion Libraries are OS independent, have been used on real-time operating system (e.g., QNX, VxWorks, and Windows CE) as well as on non-real-time system (e.g., Linux, Windows, MacOS). To get started immediately, sample make and project files are provided for the following operating systems (32-bit and 64-bit):

  • Building the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library for Linux

  • Building the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library for Microsoft Windows

  • Building the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library for Mac OS X

The library is freely released for research and educational purposes. For purposes beyond this agreement and for project files for other operating systems, please contact us.




Building the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library for Linux

After receiving the zip file, copy it to a directory of yours (e.g., /home/MyUsername/Reflexxes). After unzipping the compressed file with 

unzip ReflexxesTypeIV.zip

you may change to the directory ReflexxesTypeIV/Linux, and enter 

make clean32 all32

for 32-bit systems or 

make clean64 all64

for 64-bit systems, respectively to check whether all files compile correctly on your system. If so, a set of simple ready-to-compile sample applications are provided to learn about the Reflexxes API and to use it for your own applications.

To get an overview about the contents of the provided zip file, please refer to the page Directory Structures and Files.




Building the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library for Microsoft Windows

After receiving the zip file, copy it to a directory of yours (e.g., C:\Users\MyUsername\Reflexxes). After unzipping the compressed file with a tool (e.g., 7-Zip), you may open one of the Visual Studio solution files 

ReflexxesTypeIV\Windows_VS2005Express\WindowsVS2005Express_Solution.sln
ReflexxesTypeIV\Windows_VS2008Express\WindowsVS2008Express_Solution.sln
ReflexxesTypeIV\Windows_VS2010Express\WindowsVS2010Express_Solution.sln

with your Microsoft Visual Studio development environment. You may rebuild the entire solution to check whether all files compile correctly on your system. If so, a set of simple ready-to-compile sample applications are provided to learn about the Reflexxes API and to use it for your own applications.

To get an overview about the contents of the provided zip file, please refer to the page Directory Structures and Files.




Building the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library for Mac OS X

After receiving the zip file, copy it to a directory of yours (e.g., /home/MyUsername/Reflexxes). After unzipping the compressed file with 

unzip ReflexxesTypeIV.zip

you may change to the directory ReflexxesTypeIV/MacOS and enter 

make clean32 all32

for 32-bit systems or 

make clean64 all64

for 64-bit systems, respectively to check whether all files compile correctly on your system. If so, a set of simple ready-to-compile sample applications are provided to learn about the Reflexxes API and to use it for your own applications.

To get an overview about the contents of the provided zip file, please refer to the page Directory Structures and Files.




In case of questions or problems during the build process, please contact us.
